data.title: Good location
data.text: I was there to meet a friend.  It was a good atmosphere and close to the park where we went for a walk.  No live music at the time but I understand they do have it.

data.title: Not what it used to be
data.text: I'm sad to say that Freeman's Pub is not what it used to be. The pub itself is run-down and dingy. The service is average and the mixed drinks have little to no alcohol in them. We left after the live music started because it was so loud you couldn't have a conversation with the person next to you.

data.title: Not what I expected.
data.text: Stopped by while waiting for a uptown event to start. First visit. Wasn't overly impressed. The place lacks something. Very dark and plain. It could use some decorations. Small tables outside the front door where the smokers go. Drink prices are on the high side. Bartenders were fairly friendly.

data.title: Incredible beer and staff
data.text:
The pub is clearly a favorite among locals, as the bartender knew most of the patrons. About as family friendly as a pub can be, seeing that it's a pub. 

Great selection of local beers, all of which were fantastic. Good variety too. None of this 7 IPAs, Blue Moon, and the Domestics crap you normally see from bars offering a "great selection of craft beers!"

Finally, the food. I ordered the wings and man am I glad I did. They were some of the best I've had. Just crispy enough with a sauce I wanted to lick off the plate.

The last thing I'll say is that in addition to the food, staff, and drinks, Freeman's also has a fantastic atmosphere. It felt familiar. Like I was as welcome on my first trip as I would be on my 100th, and I can guarantee you if I lived in the area I would hit my 100th visit much faster than decent folk would consider healthy. 

Absolutely loved it.

data.title: Small and tght.
data.text: Good place to grab a beer and meet friends, but not too many. When the band is playing, it is loud. Staff is good.

data.title: Love this Pub
data.text: Great pub ! Good food and lots of drink specials,! Awesome beer selection.....owner takes pride in his business,

data.title: Surprisingly good beer list
data.text: Recommended by the Holiday Inn staff, a short cab ride landed us here.  Guiness was overpriced but with endlessly good service, price was soon forgotten.  Hot chicken salad was good and the breakfast burger was very good.  Great conversation with locals kind of place.

data.title: Sundrop infused wings
data.text: This is the closest thing to an Irish pub this side of the atlantic.  Good beer, even know how to make a half and half, and a black and tan.  The WINGS there are the BEST feature.  Sundrop infused and Apple Jamison wings have a taste that you will never forget.  Not hot wings but a smooth sweet taste.  A great treat to sit around with a pint or two and tuck away a plate of 4 of wings.

data.title: A good place to hear local songwriter talent
data.text: My husband and I go on Wednesday evenings every now and then to participate in the Original Songwriters Night at Freeman's. We lived in Nashville TN for a number of years and have certainly heard top notch performers and songwriters so we know what we are hearing. We haven't heard any bad songs/performers at Freeman's, and many have been very good, even competitive with the pros in Nashville. We perform as well, and have enjoyed the camaraderie of the group. The OSN has gotten so popular at Freeman's that each performer has a time slot for only 1 song. Their performance is video taped and posted on You Tube - a nice perk. The food at Freeman's is pretty decent for a bar - I have only had the fish and chips, and they were pretty good. The service is normally very good for such a busy night.

data.title: Support Local Music Indeed!
data.text:
I love going to Freemans when they have local bands. It's always a fun filled night. The drinks are great, the bartenders are super friendly and the local music is always a pleasure to listen to. The food is so-so, it's a tiny step up from bar food, but it's good to have when you have a few drinks in your system.

I definitely would go back again :)

data.title: LOVED IT
data.text: The wife and I went for the first time and it was great quick service, good food and a fun atmosphere will be back often.

data.title: tacky server
data.text: its more of a drunks hangout, food was over cooked. server was into her friends. we are new to the area and will never be back. so many people tell us, "its for the local drunks" . we have been there 2 different times, first time was not real good, so we gave them another chance, they blew it. never again will we waste our time and money at this place!!!

data.title: Great Selection of Beers!
data.text: A fun night, live music and definitely a Gastonia North Main Street original.  Brad the owner has been working very hard to bring good local bands into the pub and continues to experiment with his menu.

data.title: Fantastic food!
data.text: Wings were incredible, tried the Jameson's sauce. Steak sandwich was equally good. We WILL be back, especially for the wings!

data.title: Pub describes it best
data.text: Food is simple, but NOT bar food, more like tavern quality.  Full bar and entertaining and friendly staff.  Live music.  Great place to unwind.

data.title: Half Price Apps!
data.text:
I got the irish nachos one sunday afternoon and not only was this mountain of smothered home made "chips" delicious but for around $3 I got so full I even had to take half of it home! Well actually ate it on the way home. 
Great price, Large portion of quality home styled food. 
I however no longer drink but when I did they had a great selection of brew at good prices, too.

data.title: Huge beer menu!
data.text: This is a great local spot!  If you are looking for food they have a menu with burgers, wings, sandwiches, and a few other items.  They have a fantastic beer selection and they really know their stuff.  My husband regularly says, " I like this.... what do you recommend?" and the staff does a great job.  It is locally owned and if you go on any kind of regular basis they get to know you and what you like.  It's like my own version of Cheers!  We don't really go for the late night scene, but more of a happy hour/dinner.

data.title: Not my type of place
data.text: Tried this place when town was having an event for the 4th. It has potential to be a lot better but the crowd seems a little rough around the edges for my taste. I had the steak sandwich and it was actually very good. My wife had the pub burger and hers was terrible. It was overcooked and the bun was very cold, like it had been in a refrigerator.

data.title: Trivia night
data.text: Really like this pub.  Reminds me of Chicago style Irish.

data.title: Enjoy a brew at Freeman's
data.text: I loved the atmosphere, it's country and homey at the same time.  Pleasant place to eat, men u is pretty basic, but the food and surroundings are excellent.
